title: Weekly Wrap: Open Enrollment, Top Bond Funds, and Financial Independence
text:
Editor's Picks

A Checklist for Open Enrollment Season

If you're signing up for employer-provided benefits, don't just re-up for last year's choices; read this first.



The Best Bond Funds

Here are our highest-rated mutual funds and ETFs across a series of Morningstar’s fixed-income categories.



A Simple Plan for Financial Independence

Examining personal finance through the lens of economics yields a nifty road map for accumulating wealth.



How Do You Value Amazon Heading Into 2020?

Amid calls for tech breakups, should investors adopt alternative approaches to valuation?



Buckets: Not Just for Retirees

Accumulators with short- and intermediate-term financial goals can employ the concept, too.



Earnings Updates

Strong Quarter, Cautious 2020 Outlook for UnitedHealth

UnitedHealth shows momentum, but we do not expect to change our fair value estimate for the wide-moat firm.



IBM Looks Toward Cloud Solutions for Growth

We view shares as slightly undervalued but would wait for a better risk for reward entry point.

Raising Our Fair Value Estimate for JPMorgan

The wide-moat firm had a solid third quarter, and we are increasing our fair value estimate to $114.

Improved Profitability at Citigroup

We do not plan to make material changes to our fair value estimate for the narrow-moat financial-services firm.

Netflix Reports Mixed Subscriber Growth

We are retaining our narrow moat rating and fair value estimate.



Wells Fargo Takes $1.6 Billion Legal Charge in Quarter

We are lowering our fair value estimate for the wide-moat firm.

Portfolio Planning and Personal Finance With Christine Benz

What Type of Bond Funds Do You Need?

Christine Benz discusses which types of bond funds make sense for most investors.

Mutual Funds and Exchange-Traded Funds

4 Upgrades, 3 Downgrades in September

Overall, 120 strategies were rated, four of which were new to coverage.



A Checklist for Taxable-Bond-Fund Investors

Five considerations for those investing in fixed-income funds.



22 Downgrades for 2019

Kicking funds when they are down.



What to Watch for With Capital Gains Distributions

Russ Kinnel discusses some factors that can influence big payouts.



2 Winning Approaches During Volatile Times

These low-volatility funds practice very different strategies yet hold up well during market downturns.



This Fund Is Better Than It Looks

Bronze-rated Artisan Value practices a valuation-sensitive, consistent approach that stands out from the pack.



Investing Close to Home Is Overrated

Foreign stocks have an important role to play.

Stocks

BlackRock's Solid Growth Continues

Positive flows and market gains lift assets under management to a new record.

3 Tech Stocks for Dividend-Seekers

Brian Colello shares what makes these stocks stand out.



How Investors Can Play in the Video Game Space

We detail three areas of interest for investors.



A Closer Look at 3M

It may not be a pound-the-table bargain, but we like it as a defensive stock.

Rekenthaler Report

The Best Predictor of Stock-Fund Performance

It appears to be as powerful as it is unknown.

Predicting Mutual Fund Returns With the Ownership Lens

A measure invented in 2005 gets retested--and passes with flying colors.

Commentary

How and Why to Invest in Bonds: A Morningstar View

This series of articles will tackle the basics of bond investing.

These U.S. Sectors Are More Global Than You Think

Which areas of the market may be more vulnerable to ongoing trade tensions?

The Short Answer

How Do Interest Rates Affect Your Bonds?

Understanding duration can help you determine your bonds' interest-rate sensitivity.

What Are Municipal Bonds?

These five questions can help you figure out whether to invest in municipal bonds (and the best way to do it).

Advisor Insights

What Investor Biases Are Extraverts Most Prone To?

Contributor Michael Pompian shares the results of his new study of personality traits and investment biases.

The Long View

Ben Johnson: Index Funds Are Not 'Zombie Investors'

Morningstar's director of global ETF research on fee wars, performance-chasing investors, and whether passive funds are doing their fair share for corporate governance.

Sustainability Matters with Jon Hale

Cannabis Faces Significant ESG Risks

Industry would be wise to adopt sustainable practices from the beginning.

description: We recap the week on Morningstar.com and note the most popular stocks, funds, and exchange-traded funds.
